body.p: Which of the following is NOT a difference between lymphatic and blood circulation?

multiple_choice.choice: Lymphatic capillaries are more permeable than blood capillaries.
There is no pump in the lymphatic circulation.
Skeletal muscle contraction helps flow in lymphatic circulation.
All the above are differences between lymphatic and blood circulation.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Indeed lymphatic capillaries allow passing of proteins while blood capillaries do not.
Incorrect. That is a difference: blood circulation has the heart as a pump, while lymphatic has no pump.
Correct. In both, contraction of skeletal muscles helps the flow of blood/lymph.
Incorrect. There is one statement that refers to a common characteristic.

body.p: Select the correct statement about lymph transport.

multiple_choice.choice: Lymph transport depends on the movement of adjacent tissues, such as skeletal muscles.
Lymph transport is faster than that occurring in veins.
Lymph transport is only necessary when illness causes tissue swelling.
Under normal conditions, lymph vessels are very high-pressure conduits.

feedback.p: Correct. Lymph transport is helped by the “massaging” action of muscles and the “sucking” action of the movement of the thoracic cage.
Incorrect. Because of its lack of a pump, the lymph transport is very slow.
Incorrect. Lymph transport is necessary to return leaked fluids from the tissues to the blood.
Incorrect. Lymphatic vessels are leaky, low pressure vessels.
Incorrect. There is only one correct statement.

body.p: Capillaries tend to leak. Consequently, the fluid that has leaked out of them needs to be drained away so that it does not accumulate in the the tissues. How is this accomplished?

multiple_choice.choice: The fluid, which is very much like serum, is collected through the blind end if the lymph capillary, then filtered through lymph nodes on the way to being returned to the cardiovascular system.
The fluid leaks back into the capillaries and the proteins end up in the lymph.
The fluid does accumulate, which is why your feet swell on an airplane.
If there is an infection the lymph system picks things up, but otherwise the blood vessels do.

feedback.p: Correct. The lymph vessels pick up everything except the red and white blood cells.
Incorrect. Both the fluid and the proteins end up in the lymph.
Incorrect. Your feet swelling on the airplane is more because of the blood pooling, since venous return requires muscle movement in your legs.
The lymph system collects fluid all the time, not just when there is an infection.
